poem:
**Lines in the Newsprint**

Fifty faces  
bound southward—  
paper walls  
of legality  
flutter and fold.

Names slip  
between borders,  
inked lines  
unravel.

Time threads  
silent stories,  
while voices  
float  
on winds  
unheard.

The sun  
sets on  
untold futures—  
walking  
on land  
seeking  
a dawn.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The blog will be closing now, but will revive on Tuesday morning. Here are a few of the day’s developments: Donald Trump said he didn’t think Pope Leo XIV’s involvement in Russia-Ukraine peace talks meant the US would play a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
